title: Andrii Abazyn
text:
Andrii Abaza (1634–1703), a Ukrainian <a href="colonel">colonel</a> in the <a href="Bratslav%20Regiment">Bratslav Regiment</a> and leader of the <a href="Cossack">Cossack</a> formations in <a href="Right-Bank%20Ukraine">Right-Bank Ukraine</a>. His father was an <a href="Abaz%D0%B0">Abazа</a>, Ottoman <a href="Grand%20Vizier">Grand Vizier</a> and Pasha of the <a href="Ozu%20Eyalet">Ozu Eyalet</a> <a href="Abaza%20Mehmet">Abaza Mehmet</a>. Andrii's mother was daughter of <a href="Stanis%C5%82aw%20Koniecpolski">Stanisław Koniecpolski</a>, Polish <a href="Hetmans%20of%20the%20Polish%E2%80%93Lithuanian%20Commonwealth">Grand Crown Hetman</a>.
Campaigns.
He was badly wounded on 20 February 1703 and captured by the Poles. Later he was <a href="executed">executed</a> in Shargorod.
